clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of schizophrenia and generalized anxiety disorder

contraindications.disease: LD sub 50 sub 956 1034 mg kg Orally in rats Agitation blurred vision coma confusion constipation difficulty breathing dilated or constricted pupils diminished flow of urine dry mouth dry skin excessively high or low body temperature extremely low blood pressure fluid in the lungs heart abnormalities inability to urinate intestinal blockage nasal congestion restlessness sedation seizures shock
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Thioridazine is a trifluoro methyl phenothiazine derivative intended for the management of schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders Thioridazine has not been shown effective in the management of behaviorial complications in patients with mental retardation
